body.directions: Listen to the audio;then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following has the same pinyin final as the second character in the word in the audio?
body.correct: Job nicely done! 菜单 càidān (menu) has “an” as the second character’s pinyin final, and so does 米饭 mǐfàn (rice).
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the word in the audio several times to identify its second pinyin final, and then compare it with the words in the options.

body.quiz: Which of the following do we most likely see professionally at the location in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 服务员 fúwùyuán
options: Audio for 老师 lǎoshī
Audio for 医生 yīshēng
Audio for 教授 jiàoshòu
body.correct: Impressive work! 餐厅 cāntīng means “restaurant,” and we are most likely to see waiters or waitresses working there.
body.incorrect: Not quite… listen again several times, and think about what type of profession best fits that location.

body.quiz: In what situation will you most likely use the phrase in the audio?
body.answer: To a waiter when you order food at a restaurant
options: To your teacher when you turn in your term paper in class
To your friend at the end of a birthday party
To your classmate when you bump into each other by accident
body.correct: You got it! 请给我 qǐnggěiwǒ (please give me) is a phrase you can use to order food besides 我要 Wǒ yào (I want).
body.incorrect: Not quite. Do you want to listen to the audio one more time to fully understand the phrase?

body.quiz: Which of the following is an appropriate response to the word in the audio?
body.correct: You got it! 谢谢 xièxiè means “thanks,” and to respond to it you need to say “不客气 búkèqì (you are welcome).”
body.incorrect: Oops… listen to the audio several more times and think about what it means and how you should respond to it.
